Description: Bowl of pale brown marl pottery with flat base and convex sides, which are bevelled and curve inwards at the rim. A drop of red slip is present on the exterior. The interior is well smoothed and self slipped. Restored from three pieces.
Curator's comments: Like Late ware, L16B in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric pottery, or 17n in Petrie’s Corpus of Proto-dynastic pottery (1953). Grave 168 in the Fort Cemetery was excavated by John Garstang and is published in B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis (1987), p. 172
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
